info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 26 at 3:17PM EDT until July 26 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Rutherford County in western North Carolina... Southern Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 316 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles southeast of Forest City, or near Mooresboro, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Shelby, Boiling Springs NC, Patterson Springs, Ellenboro, Lattimore, Mooresboro, Earl, Cliffside, Henrietta and Caroleen. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
